intro: Wetriaria, commonly known as the marsh holly, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Ericaceae. It is characterized by its evergreen shrubs with small, leathery leaves and clusters of bell-shaped flowers. These plants typically thrive in wet, acidic soils and are often found in bogs or marshy areas. Wetriaria species are known for their ability to tolerate waterlogged conditions, making them important components of wetland ecosystems. Their floral structure is adapted for pollination by insects, contributing to their ecological significance.
